result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamond D Bryant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Based on ability to pay court set restitution at $2,500.00 payable to Tamika T.

Provide DNA sample-fee waived in the interest of paying restitution.
AS TO RESTITUITION/All applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant.
After serving 18 months, the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain HSED or GED or be provided with literacy services.

No contact with Tamika T.
No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

Cooperate with the department.
Complete cognitive intervention.
AODA assessment.   Cooperate with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screeens.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176 the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession, voting.

records.addlTxt:
Presentence report reviewed.  Statements made as to sentencing.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, with credit for 37 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 years; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 years.  After serving 18 motnhs, the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Terms of extended supervision:
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-Cooperate with the Department
-AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment
-Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens
-Complete cognitive intervention
-No-contact with Tamika T.
-Seek and maintain full time employment
-Obtain HSED or GED or be provided with literacy services
Based on ability to pay court set restitution at $2,500 payable to Tamika T.  to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant
The court ordered defendant provide DNA sample--fee waived in the interest of paying restitution
The Court ordered all applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision; any balance remaining unpaid at that time is to be converted to a civil judgment against the defendant    
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession; Voting

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jamond D Bryant in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Defendant advised of the following restrictions:  Firearm possesion / Voting.  Prior to sentencing court needs academic and attendance records.  Court orders continued compliance with Jpoint and presentence investigation report.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw
Defendant Jamond D Bryant in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  James Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Jamond D Bryant in court with student intern Trisha Fritz, under the supervision of Mary Polenz for attorney Debra J Patterson.  William Berens, student intern under the supervision of Step Nolten for Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/18/14.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Tamika T.

Defendant Jamond D Bryant in court with Trisha Fritz who appears under the student practice rule and under the supervision of attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Jamond D Bryant in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
